title: The sounds of letterpress
content:
Got a nice write up in the Dubuque Telegraph Herald on Tuesday. An Equinox Present it was!

[http://www.thonline.com/article.cfm?id=257563](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017192543/http:/www.thonline.com/article.cfm?id=257563 "http://www.thonline.com/article.cfm?id=257563")

Even a [little video](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017192543/http:/www.thonline.com/multimedia/?id=2758) if you've always wondered what a Heidelberg Windmill press sounds like ;-)

Cheers!

Peter

[http://slowprint.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017192543/http:/slowprint.com/ "http://slowprint.com/") Letterpress for Typographers!  
 [http://alphabets.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017192543/http:/alphabets.com/ "http://alphabets.com/")
author: peterf

comments.content: Here's [another good letterpress video](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017192543/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iv69kB_e9KY), featuring my fellow Cornellian John Kristensen of Boston's Firefly Press. The Press isn't in Somerville anymore, and the "apprentice" in the video is now the Book Arts Program Director at Wellesley College, but it's still a brilliant ode to letterpress.
